poem:
### Giant Reflections

In the downy light of dawn,
where shadows of words
are giants themselves, I carve
through Dahl's lore, as 
ancient whispers stir
unquiet souls —
each tale a mirror, each prejudice
a stone thrown 
into the still waters 
of our conscience,
rippling through time.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Giant – exploration of Roald Dahl and antisemitism that speaks to our times As debut plays go, Giant has some very old and experienced hands behind it. Directed by Nicholas Hytner, who runs the Bridge Theatre (by way of the National Theatre) and written by Mark Rosenblatt, a director of more than two decades, it sounds like cheating to call it a debut although it is indeed Rosenblatt’s first foray into writing for the stage.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
